title: Two Sum
prompt: Given an array of integers `nums` and an integer `target`, return the indices of the two numbers such that they add up to `target`. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.
solutionOutline: Use a hash map to store previously seen numbers and their indices. For each number, check if target - num already exists.

title: Valid Parentheses
prompt:
Given a string `s` containing just the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.
A string is valid if open brackets are closed by the same type of brackets and in the correct order.
solutionOutline: Traverse the string and push expected closing brackets on a stack. Pop when encountering a closing bracket and compare.

title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
prompt: Given a string `s`, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.
solutionOutline: Use a sliding window with a map of last seen indices. Move left pointer when duplicates appear.

title: Merge Intervals
prompt: Given an array of intervals where intervals[i] = [start_i, end_i], merge all overlapping intervals and return an array of the non-overlapping intervals that cover all the intervals in the input.
solutionOutline: Sort intervals by start time, then iterate and merge if overlapping.

title: Kth Largest Element in a Stream
prompt:
Design a class that finds the kth largest element in a stream. Implement the `KthLargest(int k, int[] nums)` constructor which initializes the object with the integer k and the stream of integers nums.
Implement the `int add(int val)` method that returns the element representing the kth largest element in the stream.
solutionOutline: Maintain a min-heap of size k. When adding, push the value and pop if heap size exceeds k.

title: SQL: Second Highest Salary
prompt: Write an SQL query to report the second highest salary from the Employee table. If there is no second highest salary, the query should report null.
solutionOutline: Use `SELECT DISTINCT salary ... ORDER BY salary DESC LIMIT 1 OFFSET 1` or a window function.
